repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Unable to update the screen for external cmdline during cmdpreview.
Solution: Flush the cmdline UI before cmdpreview state.

Resolve https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20463

comment_data.body:
This breaks a few tested UI events. Why do we need to re-emit the cmdline UI event? This function seems like it was designed for an invalid message grid/cmdline area. 

Can't we safely assume an external command line will stay valid after a redraw/screen resize/whenever `redrawcmd()` is called? @bfredl

Updated the PR under the assumption that re-emitting the event is over-cautious. Not doing so avoids an issue with inccommand (the third added test). This invalidates the three removed tests, and makes `cmdline_screen_cleared()` redundant, which I removed as well.
`handled == true` means we will not emit UI events to remote UI's when a Lua callback returns true. Is that intentional and is or should it be it documented anywhere?

> This breaks a few tested UI events.

then `redrawcmdline()` is being called as a result of the cmdline _state_ changed as well. might need a bool flag to distinguish these two if we want to prune unnecessary events.

Not sure what you mean, the broken tests specifically tested for re-emitted events after `:mode`. The expected state does not change from before the redraw. 

EDIT: Resolving for now although this still feels redundant to me, perhaps it's not redundant for remote UIs IDK. Turned out it wasn't necessary to resolve the issue this tried to address in the first place, so keeping it doesn't hurt for now.
I don't like thisl. it would be better (and generalizable to other usecases) to add whatever `vim.redraw_...()` API to lua so the callback can add redraws as needed.
OK yeah sure, if we are OK with exposing `update_screen()` I'll look into a `vim.redraw`.

comment_regular_data.body: Hmm, it seems flushing the cmdline events before updating the screen for the cmdpreview is what actually fixes the original issue. Implicitly calling `update_screen()` was not necessary, and #28101 may not be either. Though that would still be preferred and may be a welcome API addition regardless.

Rebased and reduced this PR to just flush before doing cmdpreview, which I think still addresses the linked issue. (The other changes here in stale reviews may have been unnecessary.)

Fully resolving it requires removing the intentional redraw restriction that is in place by making the cmdpreview screen state non-ephemeral (planned work by @theofabilous / @famiu: #28510).

Once that is done this flush may be removed but I think this may still be nice to have as an intermediate fix that is sufficient to allow updating the screen with new cmdline state, which I think was the premise of the linked issue.

> that is sufficient to allow updating the screen with new cmdline state

No longer true after rebasing on current master.

> Rebasing on master however the drawn cmdline lags one character behind as you say.

I'm not sure what happened when I tried rebasing this earlier but retesting now it still seems to work as (I) expected with the simple repro from the the added test, also interactively(I think I had the flush commented out😆).

> With your PR, I get a segfault after entering `:%s` if I do a create/update windows in the `ext_cmdline` callback(from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/28772#issuecomment-2115393628).

I couldn't reproduce a segfault but did hit an `abort()` in `cmdpreview_restore_state()` when using noice with this PR. Moving the flush up a little prevents that, could you try again and provide repro steps if this still doesn't work for you @folke?

Yes, it works great now!!

And I no longer see any segfaults, but that might be because I also had to add in some code (not for this PR) that prevents ui updates during textlock (which I unfortunately need to check with ffi). textlock is what was triggering all the new E565 errors I kept seeing.
Would be great to have this merged. Is there anything blocking this right now?
I don't think so. This will become redundant in case #28856 pans out. But even if it does, this seems safer to backport to 0.10, if we want to do that.

title: fix(ui): flush ext_cmdline events before doing cmdpreview
